intro: Triblemma zeylanica, commonly known as the Indian cress or wild mustard, is a flowering plant native to South and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and elongated, branched fruiting structures called siliques. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides. Triblemma zeylanica is an annual herb that can be invasive in some regions, though it also has traditional medicinal uses.
